acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of 470 mg/kg for mice (HSDB (2008)), the substance was classified into Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the classification of "Group 2B" in IARC (IARC suppl. 7 (1987)), the substance was classified into Category 2. As relevant information, the substance is classified into "R" in NTP (NTP RoC (11th, 1983)). The substance is reported to be carcinogenic in mice and rats and produce mainly lung and kidney tumours following subcutaneous or intraperitoneal injections (IARC 7 (1974)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification is not possible. Data are available that flash point is 100 degC (Gangolli vol. 4 (2nd, 1999), but the test method is unknown.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There are positive results from in vivo somatic cell mutagenicity tests including bone marrow or peripheral blood micronucleus tests by oral gavage to mice (NTP DB (2004)), bone marrow chromosomal aberration test by intraperitoneal injection to mice (NTP DB (1983)) and erythrocyte micronucleus test by oral gavage and intraperitoneal injection to 2 mouse strains (HSDB (2000)). In addition, there is a report that the frequency of dominant lethal mutations increases with higher dose levels in mice (in vivo heritable germ cell mutagenicity test) (HSDB (2000)). Based on these results, the substance was classified into Category 1B. As relevant information, from in vitro mutagenicity tests, there are reports of a positive Ames test and a positive CHO cell chromosomal aberration test (NTP DB (1982, 1987)).

hazardous_to_ozone.rationale: This substance is not listed in Annexes to the Montreal Protocol.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification is not possible since the substance contains oxygens and some of them are chemically bonded to atoms other than carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In a test where male rats administered by gavage for 5 days and mated to untreated females, effects on male fertility index and reduction in number of implants are reported (RTECS (2008): TXAPA9 Toxicology and Applied Pharmacology. 70 (1983)). Information on resorbed implants, fetal death and growth restriction are reported separately (RTECS (2008): JTSCDR Journal of Toxicological Sciences. 25 (2000)). In a similar test in mice, effects on male fertility index and death of offspring (RTECS (2008): JACTDZ Journal of the American College of Toxicology. 2 (2) (1983)) were reported. In addition, there are report that intraperitoneal injection to rats caused defect of limb and head (Birth Defects (3rd, 2000)) and that the substance produced subfertility and larger doses caused complete sterility in mice (IARC vol. 7 (1974)). It was also reported that intraperitoneal injection to pregnant mice induced high frequencies of midgestation and late fetal deaths, and of malformations among some of the surviving fetuses (HSDB (2008)). The data for oral route are on the document in List 3 and the details are unknown, and other data are results by intraperitoneal injection. Based upon the available information, the substance was classified into Category 2 since there is insufficient evidence to classify it in Category 1B.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
